project_abstract.cdata: The  Cocoa Project for Cameroon, to be carried out in the main cocoa zone around Yaounde in the period 1974-80, will involve, rehabilitating some 35,000 ha of existing cocoa and planting up to 15,000 ha of new land with high-yielding hybrid cocoa; strengthening the extension services to help farmers control disease and improve their cultivation practices and to supply them with the necessary inputs and credit facilities; providing training for some 230 extension workers and 2,000 new cocoa farmers; improving 950 km of rural roads; equipping and staffing the new agency, and take over responsibility for the development of cocoa production in the area; research; and consulting services.
